page.title: 08Park Farm
page.content: This aspect of the Miserden Estate Farming is concerned with the rearing of{pheasants}as game birds. The work is carried out by the{Gamekeeper}and two assistants. About{10,000 birds}are reared between May and August.They start in special pens and are fed three times a day. Later in the year feed points in the woods are set up together with straw which is to draw the birds to the area of the drive. {The shoot covers 15 days in November and the days' shooting is kept very much as a private concern of the Wills family.7 days can be bought by outside concerns e.g. French banking companies or American groups. Each 'gun' receives a complimentary {brace,}most of the birds being sold to game dealers for later sale in shops.
